comment: Honestly, do not take her. Shes horrible. Her final is so hard for no reason. I had an A in her class until her final. She doesnt care. Shes lazy. Unresponsive. Shell tell you certain content is on the exams and it wont be there.

She does not do well with communication such as emailing back. She is also a hard grader. She requires the book but we barely use it. The quizzes are nothing like the material that is given to us. Makes the material way harder than what it needs to be. Do not take this professor. Please.

Absolutely insane, quizzes are extremely difficult even after studying the powerpoints. Does not record her lectures so if you want to hear her lecture you have to attend online in a live classroom. Easy material but she makes it way more difficult than it needs to be. Does the absolute MOST. Stay away.

Took this as an online class, because I have a job that hinders me to attend an in class. She was so hard and logistics is such an easy concept. I studied the powerpoints and watched all pre-recorded lectures and it still wasn't enough. She treats her online students as a hybrid meaning attend the class online (can't do that). Take anyone else, run

Doesn't answer emails, so don't expect any help. Inconsiderate of your time because she makes you play a supply chain game TWICE and it is very time consuming. Convinces you to buy the textbook but you do not need it. I promise! Exams and quizzes are from the powerpointS. Pay attention to math problems. At-ti-tude problem!

Prof does not help too much outside class, which can be a problem if you have questions. She has no office hours since she is only an adjunct and never answers her email, so forget about help from her. Class was okay, could have been better organized. Tests were somewhat hard, so STUDY the pwrpts and pay special attention to any math problems.

Logistics taught by professor Lawder is a good introduction to the subject.  There is a lot of work to do, but none of it is extremely challenging.  Just do your work and study for tests and you will get an A.  She is quite nice and has a good sense of humor.  Highly recommended.
Not a fun class. Lot of group and out of class work. Prof gets attitude.

Statistics was really difficult with her, if you aren't strong in this area do not take her. I found a tutor right away. She curves her tests a lot and basically grades homework for completion. Just don't expect to understand the material she presents in class.

She's really nice but doesnt explain material very well. She curves a ton on all of the tests and goes easy on the homework too. If statistics or logistics isnt your strong area, take someone else or find a tutor!
